Name: Sarcophagus of Kai-em-nofret
Description: In its overall execution, the monumental sarcophagus of Kai-em-nofret is an absolute masterpiece. The outer faces display a regular niche pattern, the so-called palace facade. This indicates the significance of the sarcophagus as a house of the deceased in the hereafter. The vaulted lid has bulbous projections at either end which were never removed. Both the box and the lid contain on one side a short identical inscription giving the name and title of the owner.
